definition: seeing is believing
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely
to believe what one sees, not what one hears (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2 , er3 ting1 wei2 xu1

definition: Take what you hear to be false, only believe it when you see it (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: er3 ting1 wei2 xu1 , yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2

sentences.english: Supply authentic, but seeing is believing, welcomed the inspection.
sentences.chinese: 房源真实可信，不过眼见为实，欢迎验看。

sentences.english: Curious to see the changes for myself, I visited Shenyang last month.
sentences.chinese: 怀着眼见为实的好奇心，我上个月参观了沈阳。

sentences.english: However, seeing is believing, and we've yet to get a glimpse.
sentences.chinese: 然而，眼见为实，我们至今还没有看过他们一起打球。

sentences.english: Seeing is believing. And then disbelieving. And maybe believing once more.
sentences.chinese: 眼见为实，后引起怀疑，或许最后又再次相信。

sentences.english: Ears, seeing is believing, we conducted on-the-spot visit.
sentences.chinese: 耳听为虚，眼见为实，我们进行了实地参观。

sentences.english: Just as in his illustrations, seeing is believing.
sentences.chinese: 就好像他的插画，眼见为实。

sentences.english: The mouth says, seeing is believing.
With so much choice, how do you see the wood for the trees?
sentences.chinese: 拥有如此丰富的选择后，应该如何眼见为实？

sentences.english: Now let me talk about “visual proof“.
sentences.chinese: 现在让我来说说“眼见为实”吧。

definition: Take what you hear to be false, only believe it when you see it (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: er3 ting1 wei2 xu1 , yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2

definition: to believe what one sees, not what one hears (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2 , er3 ting1 wei2 xu1

definition: seeing once is better than hearing a hundred times (idiom); seeing for oneself is better than hearing from many others/seeing is believing
pinyin: bai3 wen2 bu4 ru2 yi1 jian4

definition: (idiom) you can't rely on a verbal agreement/just because sb says sth, doesn't mean it's true
facts speak louder than words (idiom)
pinyin: shi4 shi2 sheng4 yu2 xiong2 bian4

definition: Actual practice is the sole criterion for judging truth (item from Deng Xiaoping theory, from 1978)
pinyin: shi2 jian4 shi4 jian3 yan4 zhen1 li3 de5 wei2 yi1 biao1 zhun3
related.word: 实践是检验真理的唯一标准

definition: mere verbal statement cannot be taken as proof (idiom)
gossip/hearsay/rumor
with one's own eyes/personally
one side of the story/one-sided statement

lit. military tactics on paper (idiom)/fig. theoretical discussion that is worse than useless in practice/armchair strategist/idle theorizing/cf Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括 leading an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC
genuine or fake/true or false
True gold fears no fire. (idiom)
pinyin: zhen1 jin1 bu4 pa4 huo3 lian4

definition: bogus/ersatz/fake/mock/phoney
true or bogus/authenticity
absolutely true (idiom)/manifold/true from many points of view
